item.title: 白宫驳回商会要求减免小企业关税的申请
item.description: 白宫周四回绝了让美国小企业主立即获得关税减免的努力，称这些公司将从国会正在寻求延长的减税政策中获得经济减免。【原文：The White House on Thursday rebuffed an effort to give small U.S. business owners any immediate relief from tariffs, saying those companies would get economic relief from tax cuts that Congress is seeking to extend.】

item.title: 巴西 Gol 航空公司获得新融资以支持破产保护退出
item.description: 巴西 Gol 航空公司周四宣布，已与主要债权人达成一项新协议，为该公司可能在 6 月底前摆脱破产保护铺平了道路。【原文：Brazilian airline Gol on Thursday announced that it has struck a new deal with key creditors, paving the way for the company to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection likely by the end of June.】

item.title: 美国将提供激励措施促进空中交通招聘和留用
item.description: 美国运输部周四表示，正在采取措施留住和招聘更多的空中交通管制员，以解决人员严重短缺的问题。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said Thursday it is taking steps to retain and recruit more air traffic controllers to address a significant staffing shortage.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯详细介绍在美国阿拉巴马州的生产投资计划
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰公司（Mercedes-Benz）周四表示，该公司计划于2027年开始在阿拉巴马州塔斯卡卢萨（Tuscaloosa）的工厂生产一款新车，这是继美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）咄咄逼人的汽车关税之后，汽车制造商宣布的一系列投资中最新的一项。【原文：Mercedes-Benz plans to begin producing a new vehicle at its Tuscaloosa, Alabama, plant in 2027, the company said Thursday, the latest in a series of investments carmakers have announced following U.S. President Donald Trump's aggressive auto tariffs.】

item.title: 零售业收益黯淡表明消费者正感受到美国关税的压力
item.description: 麦当劳（McDonald's）和哈雷戴维森（Harley-Davidson）等面向消费者的公司季度业绩不佳，这是美国贸易政策转变导致美国购物者抑制消费的最新迹象。【原文：Lackluster quarterly results from consumer-facing companies including McDonald's and Harley-Davidson are the latest sign that American shoppers are curbing spending amid shifting U.S. trade policies.】

item.title: 独家报道卡塔尔能源公司与日本就长期液化天然气供应协议进行谈判
item.description: 全球最大的液化天然气供应商之一卡塔尔能源公司[RIC:RIC:QATPE.UL]的五位贸易和行业消息人士告诉路透社，该公司正在与日本公司洽谈一项长期协议，从其北部气田扩建项目中供应液化天然气。【原文：One of the world's biggest liquefied natural gas suppliers, QatarEnergy [RIC:RIC:QATPE.UL], is in talks with Japanese firms for a long-term deal to supply LNG from its North Field expansion project, five trading and industry sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国众议院投票禁止加州 2035 年电动汽车计划
item.description: 美国众议院周四投票决定禁止加利福尼亚州到 2035 年停止销售纯汽油车的里程碑计划，该计划已被其他 11 个州采纳。【原文：The U.S House of Representatives voted Thursday to bar California's landmark plan to end the sale of gasoline-only vehicles by 2035 that has been adopted by 11 other states.】

item.title: 科威特在电力危机中打击加密货币挖矿活动
item.description: 科威特对加密货币矿工发起打击，指责他们是导致停电的电力危机的 "主要 "原因，因为当局试图在酷热的夏季开始前缓解电网压力。【原文：Kuwait has launched a crackdown on cryptocurrency miners it accuses of being a "major" cause of a power crisis that has led to blackouts, as authorities seek to ease pressure on the grid before the start of a sweltering summer.】

item.title: 美国三月份建筑支出下降
item.description: 由于私人和公共项目的支出普遍下降，美国 3 月份的建筑支出意外下降。【原文：U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in March amid broad declines in outlays on private and public projects.】

item.title: 4 月份美国制造业下滑加剧
item.description: 4 月份，美国制造业进一步萎缩，而进口商品关税对供应链造成压力，使投入品的价格居高不下。【原文：U.S. manufacturing contracted further in April while tariffs on imported goods were straining supply chains, keeping prices paid for inputs elevated.】

item.title: 教皇去世、美国削减援助使梵蒂冈推动债务减免的工作复杂化
item.description: 教皇方济各的去世和美国主导的全球援助削减可能会使梵蒂冈召集的一个专家小组的工作复杂化，该小组旨在为世界贫困人口提供债务减免和更公平的融资体系。【原文：The death of Pope Francis and global aid cuts led by the United States could complicate the work of a group of experts assembled by the Vatican to bring debt relief and a fairer financing system to the world's poor.】

item.title: 嘉信理财首席执行官称投资者正在 "去风险化 "和多样化
item.description: 嘉信理财首席执行官里克-沃斯特（Rick Wurster）表示，投资者对整个四月份的市场动荡做出了反应，降低了所承担的风险水平，并对资产配置做出了一些调整，倾向于债券和非美股。【原文：Investors have responded to the market turmoil throughout April by dialing down the level of risk they are taking and making some shifts in their asset allocation in favor of bonds and non-U.S. stocks, says Charles Schwab CEO Rick Wurster.】

item.title: 受关税不确定性影响，加拿大工厂采购经理人指数创近五年新低
item.description: 由于美国贸易政策的不确定性对生产和新订单造成了影响，加拿大制造业活动在 4 月份出现了自 COVID-19 大流行开始后不久以来最大幅度的萎缩。【原文：Canadian manufacturing activity contracted in April at the steepest rate since shortly after the start of the COVID-19 pandemic as the uncertain nature of U.S. trade policy weighed on production and new orders.】

item.title: 因违反政策，科尔百货解除阿什利-布坎南的首席执行官职务
item.description: 科尔百货公司（Kohl's）周四表示，在调查发现首席执行官阿什利-布坎南（Ashley Buchanan）违反公司政策后，该公司解除了其首席执行官职务。【原文：Kohl's removed Ashley Buchanan as CEO following an investigation that uncovered company policy violations by the chief executive, the department store chain said on Thursday.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮催热数据中心租赁需求，铁山公司上调业绩预期
item.description: 房地产投资信托公司铁山公司（Iron Mountain）周四上调了年度盈利预期，押注于希望采用人工智能技术的企业对其数据中心租赁需求的激增。【原文：Real estate investment trust Iron Mountain raised its annual earnings forecast on Thursday, betting on surging demand for its data center leases from businesses looking to adopt artificial intelligence technologies.】

item.title: 美国消费放缓，凯拉诺瓦销售额未达预期
item.description: 品客（Pringles）生产商凯兰诺瓦公司（Kellanova）周四公布的第一季度净销售额未达市场预期，原因是该公司最大市场的消费者支出因通货膨胀而减弱。【原文：Pringles maker Kellanova missed market expectations for first-quarter net sales on Thursday, as consumer spending weakened in the company's biggest market due to inflation.】

item.title: 福特汽车 4 月份美国销量增长 16
item.description: 福特汽车周四公布，受强劲的卡车需求和员工定价计划的影响，4月份美国汽车销量增长了16%。【原文：Ford Motor on Thursday reported a 16% rise in U.S. auto sales for April, aided by strong truck demand and its employee pricing program.】

item.title: 金融科技公司 Broadridge 的利润因投资者交流部门的强劲表现而飙升
item.description: 金融科技公司 Broadridge Financial 周四公布，受投资者沟通部门强劲增长的帮助，第三季度利润大幅增长 14%。【原文：Fintech firm Broadridge Financial reported a 14% jump in third-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by strong growth in its investor communications unit.】

item.title: 信中称，Third Point 持有美国钢铁公司股份，看到了信贷领域的机遇
item.description: 对冲基金Third Point持有美国钢铁公司 "重要 "的股份，并预计计划中的收购交易将继续推进，该基金还认为，随着投资者适应特朗普政府实施的政策，信贷市场将出现机会。【原文：Hedge fund Third Point owns a "meaningful" stake in U.S. Steel and expects a planned takeover deal to move ahead, and also sees opportunities in the credit markets as investors adjust to policies imposed by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 造船业者亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司季度盈利因销量放缓而下降
item.description: 美国军用造船厂亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司（Huntington Ingalls）报告称，第一季度利润和收入下降，部分原因是为海军制造航空母舰的工厂生产持续放缓。【原文：U.S. military shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls reported a fall in first-quarter profit and revenue, weighed down in part by a continued slowdown at its facility that makes aircraft carriers for the Navy.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚选民再次向 TikTok 寻求指导，重新举行被宣布无效的选举
item.description: 在周日重新举行的总统选举中，许多罗马尼亚年轻人再次通过视频共享平台 TikTok 寻找如何投票的指导。【原文：Many young Romanians are again scrolling through video-sharing platform TikTok for guidance on how to vote in Sunday's rerun of a presidential election annulled over allegations of Russian meddling via suspicious TikTok accounts.】

item.title: 由于弗吉尼亚州和南卡罗来纳州的电力需求，Dominion 季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 美国公用事业公司 Dominion Energy 周四公布的第一季度营收和利润高于华尔街预期，主要得益于利息成本降低以及弗吉尼亚州和南卡罗来纳州的强劲需求。【原文：U.S. utility Dominion Energy reported first-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, helped by lower interest costs and strong demand from Virginia and South Carolina.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数增幅超过预期
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数增幅超过预期，这可能暗示关税导致裁员人数回升，而关税在第一季度对经济造成了拖累。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased more than expected last week, potentially hinting at a pick-up in layoffs from tariffs, which weighed on the economy in the first quarter.】

item.title: 雅戈尔称正在重新评估芝浦电子的收购条件
item.description: 台湾电子零件制造商雅居乐周四表示，正在重新评估其对日本芝浦电子公司（Shibaura Electronics）的要约收购条件，这是在其竞争对手提高出价后采取的举措。【原文：Taiwanese electronic parts maker Yageo said on Thursday it was re-evaluating the terms of its tender offer for Japan's Shibaura Electronics , a move that came after its rival suitor raised its bidding price.】

item.title: 独家报道印度航空公司认为巴基斯坦的空域禁令将在 12 个月内使其损失 6 亿美元，因此寻求援助
item.description: 路透社看到的一封印度航空公司的信函显示，如果巴基斯坦的空域禁令持续一年，印度航空公司预计将面临约 6 亿美元的额外成本，并已要求联邦政府赔偿损失。【原文：Air India expects to face around $600 million in additional costs if a ban from Pakistan's airspace lasts for a year, and has asked the federal government to compensate it for the hit, a company letter seen by Reuters shows.】

item.title: 由于电费上涨，Exelon 第一季度利润超出预期
item.description: 受电费上涨的影响，美国公用事业公司 Exelon 周四公布的第一季度利润超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：U.S. utility Exelon surpassed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by higher electricity rates.】

item.title: 好时因北美零食需求旺盛而实现强劲季度业绩
item.description: 好时公司周四公布的第一季度销售额降幅小于预期，利润超出预期，主要得益于北美市场对咸味零食业务的稳定需求。【原文：Hershey posted a smaller-than-expected drop in sales for the first quarter and beat profit estimates on Thursday, helped by steady demand for its salty snacks business in North America.】

item.title: 万事达卡第一季度利润因消费者支出回升而大幅增长
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策引发了经济不确定性，但万事达卡（Mastercard）周四公布第一季度利润大增，原因是其银行卡网络的消费恢复了活力。【原文：Mastercard reported a surge in first-quarter profit on Thursday after resilient spending in its card network despite the economic uncertainty sparked by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policies.】

item.title: 不惧关税不确定性，Roblox 提高年度预订量预期
item.description: Roblox 周四上调了年度预订额预期，季度业绩超过预期，这表明尽管美国关税引发了经济不确定性，但其庞大的用户生成电子游戏库的支出仍在保持增长。【原文：Roblox raised its annual bookings forecast on Thursday and beat quarterly results estimates, a sign that spending on its vast library of user-generated videogames was holding up despite economic uncertainty driven by U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 美国财政部长敦促美联储降息
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四呼吁美国联邦储备委员会降息，称两年期利率收益率低于美联储基金利率。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Thursday called on the U.S. Federal Reserve to cut rates, saying yields on two-year rates were lower than Fed fund rates.】
